oracle.pg.text

Interface OracleAutoIndex<T extends com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Element>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Index<T>, OracleIndex<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LuceneAutoIndex, LuceneEdgeAutoIndex, LuceneVertexAutoIndex, OracleTextAutoIndex, RDBMSLuceneEdgeAutoIndex, RDBMSLuceneVertexAutoIndex, RDBMSOracleTextEdgeAutoIndex, RDBMSOracleTextVertexAutoIndex, RDBMSSolrEdgeAutoIndex, RDBMSSolrVertexAutoIndex, SolrAutoIndex, SolrEdgeAutoIndex, SolrVertexAutoIndex

    public interface OracleAutoIndex<T extends com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Element>
extends OracleIndex<T>
    An interface that extends the functions defined in OracleIndex to provide manage an automatic index.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface oracle.pg.text.OracleIndex

        EDGE_ID_PROP, EDGE_LABEL_PROP, END_NODE_ID_PROP, m_dtValues, START_NODE_ID_PROP, TYPE_DT_BOOL, TYPE_DT_BYTE, TYPE_DT_CHAR, TYPE_DT_DATE, TYPE_DT_DOUBLE, TYPE_DT_FLOAT, TYPE_DT_INTEGER, TYPE_DT_JSON, TYPE_DT_LONG, TYPE_DT_SERIALIZABLE, TYPE_DT_SHORT, TYPE_DT_SPATIAL, TYPE_DT_STRING, TYPE_DT_URI, VERTEX_ID_PROP

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsIndexedKey(java.lang.String key)
      Verifies if the given key is already indexed using this automatic index.
      com.tinkerpop.blueprints.CloseableIterable<T> get(java.lang.String key, java.lang.Object value, boolean acceptWildcard)
      Gets an Iterable object with all the matching elements that have a particular key/value property within the index
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getIndexedKeys()
      Get the keys associated to this auto index.
      void indexElements()
      Index elements in a property graph with respect to the current indexed keys.
      void reindexElements()
      Re-index the elements of the associated property graph based on the current indexed keys.
      void reindexElementsPartitioned()
      Re-index the elements of the associated property graph based on the current indexed keys using getElementsPartitioned APIs.

    • Method Detail

      • containsIndexedKey

        boolean containsIndexedKey(java.lang.String key)
        Verifies if the given key is already indexed using this automatic index.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to validate
        Returns:
        true if the key is indexed in this automatic index, else false.

      • get

        com.tinkerpop.blueprints.CloseableIterable<T> get(java.lang.String key,
                                                  java.lang.Object value,
                                                  boolean acceptWildcard)
        Gets an Iterable object with all the matching elements that have a particular key/value property within the index
        Specified by:
        get in interface OracleIndex<T extends com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Element>
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property. It MUST not be NULL. If the key is not found in the index, the result will be 0.
        value - the value object of the property. It can be NULL which will cause all elements with the given key to be returned.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterable object.

      • getIndexedKeys

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getIndexedKeys()
        Get the keys associated to this auto index.
        Returns:
        the set of keys used in this index.

      • indexElements

        void indexElements()
        Index elements in a property graph with respect to the current indexed keys.

      • reindexElements

        void reindexElements()
        Re-index the elements of the associated property graph based on the current indexed keys.

      • reindexElementsPartitioned

        void reindexElementsPartitioned()
        Re-index the elements of the associated property graph based on the current indexed keys using getElementsPartitioned APIs.
